page.title: 10The Free Church, St Ives
page.content:
The Free Church (United Reformed), is situated in the Market Place of St Ives, where it dominates the street scene. In 1980 it underwent major changes to its structure and its use.
A floor was built to produce upstairs rooms and the church became a church community centre. Organisations using it have their own committees but the centre has 2 full_time, 7 part_time and 60 volunteer helpers. The warden of the centre is the Minister, assisted by the Community Minister.
The usual religious services take place on Sundays, the Minister seeing the religious and community aspects as one entity.
